arts.ttl: Hopping mad, bookings and fist pumps - I watched Chris Davies put Birmingham City top of the league
arts.sum: Already fuming at the visitors’ time-wasting, which started after about ten minutes, Davies fired his first volley at Peacock-Farrell, not for gifting Ricky-Jade Jones a brainless goal but for going off script and lumping the ball long. Indeed in his post-match press conference Davies admitted the thrust of his half-time team ‘talk’ had been reminding his charges to implement the attacking patterns they spend so long polishing.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies explains Emil Hansson change and team talk that inspired Birmingham City comeback
arts.sum: Chris Davies hooked Emil Hansson and Lyndon Dykes at half-time against Peterborough because he wanted ‘a fresh dynamic’ – and it paid off with replacements Keshi Anderson and Scott Wright helping Birmingham City to a 3-2 comeback victory. Explaining his decision, Davies said: “As I said to the players, it wasn’t anything Emil Hansson or Lyndon Dykes had done wrong.

arts.ttl: Birmingham reclaim top spot after recovering from 2-0 down to beat Peterborough
arts.sum: The big-spending Blues remain the only undefeated team in League One.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies gives no-nonsense answer to Birmingham City's burning question
arts.sum: Blues emerged from the summer transfer window with 17 new players and a first team squad of 25, many of whom are playing beneath their ability in League One. The group is so strong that Davies recognises that some won’t accrue as many minutes as they are used to. However, winning promotion to the Championship at the first attempt is the only thing Davies is worrying about, not keeping every individual in his squad happy.

arts.ttl: Four Birmingham City absentees for Peterborough as injury list starts to clear up
arts.sum: Birmingham City's defensive numbers could soon be boosted with Ethan Laird and Dion Sanderson making progress in their recoveries from injury - but Lee Buchanan has suffered a setback. Sanderson, meanwhile, is being given time to build up his fitness after a foot injury.

arts.sum: The latest Birmingham City team news as Chris Davies' side gear up to face Peterborough United in League One. The post Dykes benched: Birmingham City team news and predicted XI to face Peterborough United appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City Extends Nike Deal, Club to Get Bespoke Kits From Nike HQ
arts.sum: Birmingham City Football Club currently only plays in League One, England's third division.

arts.sum: The72's writers offer their Birmingham City vs Peterborough United prediction ahead of the League One clash on Saturday. The post ‘An ominous sign’ – Birmingham City vs Peterborough United prediction: The72 appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: I used to manage Birmingham City - now I reject their bids for my players
arts.sum: Barry Fry still adores Birmingham City – but there was no room for sentiment when Blues enquired about signing some of his Peterborough United players during the summer transfer window. After a brilliant start to the League One campaign, with five wins and one draw, Blues are on course to make an immediate return to the Championship – and Fry thinks they will do it in style.

arts.ttl: ‘Brilliant’ – Birmingham City boss Chris Davies reacts to positive injury news
arts.sum: Birmingham City boss Chris Davies has hailed Alfie Chang’s ‘brilliant’ attitude as he continues his road to recovery.… The post ‘Brilliant’ – Birmingham City boss Chris Davies reacts to positive injury news appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
